newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Argentina's Menem in Singapore to strengthen links. [CORRECTED 09:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Menem in Singapore to strengthen links. [CORRECTED 09:50 GMT]

text.p: Argentine President Carlos Menem arrived in Singapore on Thursday, the final leg of a three country tour of Southeast Asia aimed at building links with one of the world's most economically dynamic regions.
Singapore said in a statement that the two sides were expected to sign a memorandum of understanding on private sector co-operation between the two countries.
The first official visit to Singapore by an Argentine head of state will include meetings with Singapore President Ong Teng Cheong and Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong.

Menem would also speak about new business opportunities in Argentina and the Latin American MERCUSOR economic grouping of Argentina, Brazil, Chile and Uruguay at a seminar on Friday, the Singapore statement said.

Argentine embassy officials said their country imported goods from Singapore worth Singapore $218 million (US$153.5 million) in 1996 and exported goods worth $100 million (corrects figure from $100,000) to the island state.
Menem previously visited Vietnam and Thailand.
